content.description: Sit start on the right side of the face below the large edge/jug. Climb up to edge and then to two rounded edges. Move left hand to a sidpull in the "cross" of the two seams. Move right to a high right crimp then make a long pull up and left to a thin crack/sidepull below the lip. Move up to the thank allah jug and mantle.
From the large rail at the bottom of the cave, climb out the roof to the sloping rail and make a hard rock over move.
content.location: Far left side of the boulder under the roof.

content.description: Sit start under the small roof on the right side of the boulder, just left of the boulder hugging tree. Climb out the cave and left onto the face, surf up to the lip and move left to a mantle crux.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spot

climbs.name: Deathchoss Part 3: Obligatory Third Climb in the Trilogy

content.description: All trilogies must end. Sit start under the roof on the left side of the boulder. Traverse the rail until it is possible to reach out to the fishmouth  then up to the right side of the huge hanging flake. Move right to the crack, then out and around the roof to a crux top out sequence left of the pinnacle.

The amzing sequel rivaling the Godfather Part 2 and Empire Strikes Back. Sit start on the right side of the face below a large jug, move up and traverse left through the pocket to the fishmouth. Move up to the right side of the huge hanging flake, then move right to the crack, then left out and around the roof to a crux top out sequence left of the pinnacle.

climbs.name: Deathchoss Part 1: Warriors of the Overhanging Deathchoss

content.description: The grindhouse classic that started a movement. Sit start at the left side of the face at a left angled shelf. Climb straight up to  a large fishmouth, then up to the right side of the huge hanging flake. Move right to the crack, then out and around the roof to a crux top out sequence left of the pinnacle.

Start sitting in the small cave on the far right side of boulder. Move up and left through varied holds to the center of the face and topout. The large tree came down in an early 2022 windstorm opening up the face.

Park on route 165 near the sign that says Roscoe Dexter wildlife area. Walk down the dirt road for half a mile until you see a small trail on the left that says deep pond with white blazes. 

Walk down the trail for 15 minutes until you come to a possible right hand turn that is unmarked. Take this trail on the right  and then take another immediate hard right. Follow the hill down through the rhododendrons then up a small rise to another right hand turn. Continue down another few minutes until you see a small bluff on the right. Walk off the trail for 20 yards to the boulder.
